abstract: Group of veterans with undiagnosed post-traumatic stress disorder are fighting to overturn their less-than-honorable discharges; group advocates for federal legislation that would overhaul overwhelmed and understaffed military review boards, and shift burden of proof over PTSD from troops themselves to military.
lead_paragraph: A group is pushing for a bill to overhaul the system by mandating that the military start from the presumption that PTSD contributed to the discharges.

headline.main: Veterans Want Past Discharges to Recognize Post-Traumatic Stress
headline.print_headline: Veterans Want Past Discharges to Recognize Post-Traumatic Stress

snippet: A group is pushing for a bill to overhaul the system by mandating that the military start from the presumption that PTSD contributed to the discharges.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
